Title: Apple hit with $2 billion EU antitrust fine in Spotify case, will appeal
Short Description: Brussels on Monday fined Apple 1.84 billion euros ($2 billion) for thwarting competition from music streaming rivals via restrictions on its App Store, the iPhone maker's first ever penalty for breaching EU rules.

Title: EU antitrust chief Vestager to hold news conference, Apple in focus
Short Description: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager will hold a press conference on a competition case at 1200 GMT, the European Commission said on Monday without providing details.

Title: Apple reverses decision to disable home screen web apps in EU
Short Description: Apple has reversed a decision to block web apps in the European Union that bypass its 30% App Store fees by selling subscriptions directly through their websites, the company said on Friday, after the move invited scrutiny from regulators.

Title: Number of agencies have concerns about 'sideloading' on iPhone, Apple says
Short Description: A number of government agencies in the European Union and elsewhere have voiced concerns about security risks as Apple opens up its iPhones and iPads to rival app stores to comply with EU tech rules, Apple said on Friday.

Title: Chinese retailers further discount iPhone 15
Short Description: Major Chinese third-party retailers JD.com , TMall, and Pinduoduo are battling for customers by offering more steep discounts on Apple's iPhone 15 just five months after launch, as the U.S. tech company suffers slowing sales in China.

Title: Apple picks a better road to AI dominance
Short Description: Apple’s car project has run out of road. The $2.8 trillion maker of iPhones has ended its decade-long electric-vehicle effort internally dubbed Project Titan, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday. That relinquishes a shot at a huge market. But the business of cars is increasingly cutthroat, and mostly held value as a way to capture customer data and attention. Apple has better ways to get to the same pla

Title: Apple to disclose AI plans later this year, CEO Tim Cook says
Short Description: Apple plans to disclose more about its plans to put generative artificial intelligence to use later this year, Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook said during the company's annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday.

Title: Apple met with DOJ officials to avoid antitrust lawsuit, Bloomberg reports
Short Description: Apple representatives met with U.S. Justice Department officials last week in a bid to persuade the agency not to file an antitrust suit against the iPhone maker, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Apple cancels work on electric car, source says
Short Description: Apple has canceled work on its electric car, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday, a decade after the iPhone maker kicked off the project.

Title: EU set to fine Apple in Spotify music streaming case, sources say
Short Description: Apple is set to be handed an EU antitrust fine of about 500 million euros ($543 million) next week in a music streaming case triggered by a Spotify complaint, sources said.

Title: Apple sues to win trademarks for augmented-reality software
Short Description: Apple has filed a lawsuit in Virginia federal court challenging the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office's refusal to grant trademarks covering the company's augmented-reality software development tools "Reality Composer" and "Reality Converter."

Title: At hefty premium, Russian resellers hawk Apple Vision Pro goggles
Short Description: Russia's top consumer electronics chain M.Video-Eldorado has begun sales of Apple's brand-new Vision Pro headset in its stores, despite Apple halting exports of its products to Russia nearly two years ago.

Title: Apple rolls out iMessage upgrade to withstand decryption by quantum computers
Short Description: Apple is rolling out an upgrade to its iMessage texting platform to defend against future encryption-breaking technologies.

Title: Epic Games blasts Apple demand for $73 million in legal fees
Short Description: “Fortnite” maker Epic Games has told a U.S. judge that Apple “completely overreached” in demanding that it pay a legal tab of more than $73 million in the hotly contested antitrust clash between the two companies.

Title: EU poised to fine Apple about 500 million euros, FT reports
Short Description: The European Union is set to fine Apple about 500 million euros ($539 million) over alleged breaches of EU competition law, the Financial Times reported on Sunday citing unnamed sources.

Title: Apple plans AI-based code completion tool -report
Short Description: Apple plans to launch an artificial intelligence tool for completing lines of software code, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Title: Apple to settle trade secrets lawsuit against chip startup Rivos
Short Description: Apple plans to settle a lawsuit that accused tech startup Rivos of stealing its trade secrets related to computer-chip technology, according to a joint court filing on Friday in California federal court.

Title: Spain's high court suspends $209 million fines on Apple, Amazon amid appeal
Short Description: Spain's high court suspended 194 million euros ($209 million) in fines imposed on Amazon and Apple by the local antitrust watchdog in July, pending an appeal by the tech giants, an Amazon spokesperson said on Thursday.

Title: Apple defeats lawsuit claiming it overpaid CEO Tim Cook, others
Short Description: A federal judge on Wednesday dismissed a lawsuit accusing Apple of overpaying Chief Executive Tim Cook and other top executives by tens of millions of dollars by miscalculating the value of performance-based stock awards.

Title: Apple is developing foldable clamshell iPhones - The Information
Short Description: Apple is building prototypes of at least two iPhones that fold widthwise like a clamshell, The Information reported on Wednesday, citing a person with direct knowledge of the situation.

Title: Apple beats AliveCor lawsuit over heart-rate apps for Apple Watch
Short Description: Apple persuaded a federal judge to dismiss a lawsuit by a Silicon Valley startup accusing it of illegally monopolizing the U.S. market for heart rate monitoring apps for its Apple Watch.

Title: Apple wants ‘speculative’ consumer lawsuit over crypto tech dismissed
Short Description: Apple has asked a U.S. judge to dismiss a consumer lawsuit accusing the iPhone maker of unlawfully barring apps that facilitate cryptocurrency transactions and driving up fees at platforms such as Venmo and Cash App.

Title: Vision Pro headset is Apple's next Mac and TV combined
Short Description: Apple's Vision Pro could upend how people watch television at home and how they use computers at work, potentially positioning the headset to be a successor to both traditional television and the Mac.

Title: Judge certifies Apple app store class action
Short Description: A federal judge on Friday said tens of millions of Apple customers can pursue a class action accusing the company of monopolizing the market for iPhone apps by banning purchases outside its App Store, leading to higher prices.

Title: Apple's China sales tumble highlights waning clout as local brands gain
Short Description: As the world's largest smartphone market, China is crucial to Apple's sales growth.

Title: Apple China sales lag overshadows quarterly profit, revenue beats
Short Description: Apple on Thursday reported China sales that missed Wall Street targets, overshadowing overall sales and profit that beat analysts' targets, powered by iPhone growth.

Title: Tata, Pegatron in partnership talks for iPhone assembly in India's Tamil Nadu - sources
Short Description: Tata Group is in advanced talks with Taiwan's Pegatron to form a partnership to run an iPhone assembly plant the Indian company is building in the southern state of Tamil Nadu, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.

Title: Apple set for modest iPhone sales growth, China worries remain
Short Description: Apple iPhone sales likely rose 3% in the key holiday period, the best growth in five quarters, but analysts expect a tough year for the company in China, where it faces regulatory headwinds and resurgent competition from Huawei.

Title: Spotify says Apple's plan to comply with EU regulation 'farce'
Short Description: Spotify said on Friday that Apple's new plan to comply with the European Union's Digital Markets Act (DMA) is "a complete and total farce."

Title: Exclusive: Apple faces 'strong action' if App Store changes fall short, EU's Breton says
Short Description: Apple faces strong action if changes to its App Store do not meet incoming European Union regulations, the bloc's industry chief said on Friday.

Title: Apple to allow downloads outside App Store in EU, with new fees
Short Description: Apple on Thursday outlined its plans to allow software developers to distribute their apps to users in the European Union outside of Apple's own App Store.

Title: Apple's iPhone shipments in China drop 2% in Q4 as Huawei grows market share
Short Description: Apple's smartphone shipments in China shrank 2.1% in the final quarter of 2023 from the same year-ago period, hurt by intensifying competition from local rivals led by Huawei, data from research firm IDC showed on Thursday.

Title: Apple plans new fees, restrictions for downloads outside App Store - WSJ
Short Description: Apple plans to add new fees and restrictions when it starts allowing third-party software downloads outside its App Store, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Title: Apple bids to throw out $1 bln UK lawsuit over app store fees
Short Description: Apple on Tuesday asked a London tribunal to throw out a mass lawsuit valued at around $1 billion brought on behalf of more than 1,500 app developers over its App Store fees.

Title: Fact Check: Old photo does not show Apple CEO at January 2024 Samsung Galaxy event
Short Description: An old photo of Apple CEO Tim Cook has been edited and miscaptioned online to suggest that he had been spotted at a Samsung Galaxy event in January 2024.

Title: Apple pays $13.7 mln Russian fine, antitrust agency says
Short Description: U.S. tech giant Apple has paid a Russian fine of 1.2 billion roubles ($13.65 million), imposed over the company's alleged abuse of its dominant market position concerning in-app payments, Russia's FAS antitrust agency said on Monday.

Title: US Supreme Court snubs Apple-Epic Games legal battle
Short Description: The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday declined to hear a challenge by Apple to a lower court's decision requiring changes to certain rules in its lucrative App Store, as the justices shunned the lengthy legal battle between the iPhone maker and Epic Games, maker of the popular video game "Fortnite."

Title: Redesigned Apple Watches not subject to import ban, US Customs says
Short Description: A U.S. law enforcement agency has determined that Apple can use a redesign to bypass an import ban on newer Apple Watch models stemming from its patent infringement dispute with Masimo , the medical-monitoring technology company said in a court filing on Monday.

Title: Apple offers iPhone 15 at rare discount in China as competition intensifies
Short Description: Apple is offering rare discounts on its iPhones in China, cutting retail prices by as much as 500 yuan ($70) amid growing competitive pressure in the world's biggest smartphone market.

Title: U.S. appeals court upholds tribunal decisions in Apple-Masimo patent dispute
Short Description: A U.S. appeals court on Friday upheld two earlier decisions by a patent tribunal that favored Masimo in its intellectual property dispute with Apple over blood oxygen sensors in newer Apple Watch models.

Title: US ITC opposes Apple's motion for stay pending appeal in smartwatches case
Short Description: The U.S. International Trade Commission on Wednesday opposed Apple's motion for a stay pending appeal in a case involving sales of the company's flagship smartwatches, a court filing showed.

Title: Apple disputes EU rules labelling its 5 App Stores as one service
Short Description: Apple has challenged EU tech rules designating its five App Stores as a single core platform service subject to onerous obligations, saying that EU regulators have misinterpreted and misapplied the new legislation that took effect last May.

Title: Apple's Vision Pro AR headset to go on sale in February
Short Description: Apple said on Monday its Vision Pro device will be available in the United States from Feb. 2, months after it was launched to capture an augmented-reality (AR) headset market dominated by Facebook-parent Meta Platforms .

Title: Apple iPhone sales in China fall 30% in first week of 2024 - Jefferies
Short Description: Apple 's iPhone sales in China dropped by 30% in the first week of 2024, Jefferies analysts said in a note, adding to signs of growing competitive pressures from domestic rivals such as Huawei (HWT.UL) for the U.S. tech giant.

Title: US regulator denies Apple, Disney bids to skip votes on AI
Short Description: Apple and Disney cannot avoid shareholder votes about their use of artificial intelligence put forward by a labor group, the top U.S. securities regulator has ruled.

Title: Apple slides to eight-week low after second rating downgrade in a week
Short Description: Apple continued its struggle in the new year on Thursday, plumbing an eight-week low after Piper Sandler handed the tech giant its second downgrade this week on worries about iPhone demand.

Title: Apple agrees to settle lawsuit over iTunes gift card scam
Short Description: Apple has agreed to settle a lawsuit accusing the company of knowingly letting scammers exploit its gift cards, and keep stolen funds for itself.

Title: Apple hits seven-week low after Barclays downgrade
Short Description: Apple on Tuesday fell 3% to a seven-week low after Barclays downgraded the shares of the world's most valuable firm on concerns that demand for its devices from the iPhone to Mac will remain weak in 2024.

Title: India's govt demanded Apple soften impact of hack warnings -Washington Post
Short Description: Apple's warnings in October to Indian opposition politicians that government hackers may have hacked their phones prompted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's administration to quickly demand the U.S. firm soften its message, the Washington Post reported.

Title: Apple can temporarily sell smartwatches after US appeals court win
Short Description: Apple can for now resume sales of its flagship smartwatches, after a U.S. appeals court on Wednesday paused a government commission's import ban on the devices imposed in a patent dispute over its medical monitoring technology.

Title: Explainer: What is next after pause of US Apple Watch import ban?
Short Description: A U.S. appeals court on Wednesday temporarily paused a ruling that had restricted imports of Apple's popular Apple Watches into the United States.

Title: Apple explores AI deals with news publishers - New York Times
Short Description: Apple has opened negotiations in recent weeks with major news and publishing organizations, seeking permission to use their material in the company's development of generative artificial intelligence systems, the New York Times reported on Friday.

Title: Disney’s 2024 lifeline leads to Tim Cook
Short Description: Walt Disney and Apple have a history together. A future partnership could be on the cards too. Disney Chief Executive Bob Iger is seeking a team-mate for sports network ESPN. Apple head Tim Cook is expanding into soccer and baseball coverage for its streaming service. In 2024, Iger could look to Cook for a deal.

Title: Apple sued with Visa, Mastercard in card-fee antitrust case
Short Description: Apple, Visa and Mastercard have been hit with a new proposed class action that accuses them of conspiring to thwart competition for point-of-sale payment card network services, causing merchants to pay artificially higher fees for credit and debit transactions.

Short Description: Apple's stock reached a record high close on Wednesday, lifted in a broad Wall Street rally after the Federal Reserve signaled lower borrowing costs are coming in 2024.

Title: Apple to be hit by EU antitrust order in fight with Spotify - Bloomberg News

Short Description: Apple has offered to let rivals access its tap-and-go mobile payments systems used for mobile wallets, three people familiar with the matter said, a move that could settle EU antitrust charges and stave off a possible hefty fine.

Title: Apple's iPhone and watch design head to depart in February - Bloomberg News
Short Description: The Apple executive leading design for the iPhone and smartwatch, Tang Tan, is leaving the company in February, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.

Title: Apple to move key iPad engineering resources to Vietnam- Nikkei

Short Description: Apple's former top corporate lawyer will receive no prison time after pleading guilty last year to U.S. insider trading charges, a judge said on Thursday.

Title: Apple-backed study finds rise in data breaches as iPhone maker defends encryption stance
Short Description: In the first nine months of 2023, U.S. data breaches increased by 20% compared to the full year 2022, according to a new study that was commissioned by Apple .

Title: Analyzing the ITC's impending import ban on Apple watches

Milliken and Kristina Caggiano Kelly of Sterne, Kessler, Goldstein & Fox PLLC discuss the impact of a ruling by the International Trade Commission granting medical-device maker Masimo Corp.'s request for a ban on imports of certain models of Apple Watches.

Short Description: Apple and Paramount Global have discussed bundling their streaming services at a discount, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.

Title: Apple files legal challenge to EU's Digital Markets Act

Title: Apple to make messaging between iPhones and Android devices easier
Short Description: Apple said it plans to adopt a messaging standard next year that will allow for a smoother texting experience between iPhones and Android devices.

Title: Google antitrust trial crystallizes Apple’s risk
Short Description: The antitrust case against Google is spelling out some serious problems. According to witness testimony this week, Alphabet’s search unit gives Apple more than a third of the ad revenue generated from its iPhones and other devices. If the arrangement were to unravel, it would have very clear impacts for boss Tim Cook and his company’s valuation.

Title: Apple's iPhone 14 users get another year of free satellite SOS access

Title: Apple's iPhone 14 users get another year of free satellite SOS access
Short Description: Apple said on Wednesday iPhone 14 users would get free access to its emergency SOS feature for another year.

Title: US lawmakers question Apple over Jon Stewart's China content

Title: Apple to file challenge over Digital Markets Act in EU court - Bloomberg News

Short Description: Apple investors will have one big question when the world's most valuable company reports earnings on Thursday - will Huawei's resurgence in China dampen its holiday-quarter expectations?

Short Description: Alphabet Inc's (GOOGL.O) Google said on Thursday it would open its first physical store in New York City this summer, mirroring a retail approach that has helped Apple Inc (AAPL.O) rake in billions of dollars in the last two decades.

Title: Santander to pump up payments business in bid to boost valuation
Short Description: Santander (SAN.MC) expects to triple revenues in its payments business PagoNxt to around 1 billion euros ($1.2 billion) in the next few years as it moves to compete with major players in the business such as Apple Pay and Stripe.

Title: Microsoft to unplug Internet Explorer as it seeks edge in browser war
Short Description: Microsoft Corp (MSFT.O) is pulling the plug on its once omnipresent browser, Internet Explorer, next year as it prepares to battle market leader Chrome with its slicker Edge browser.

Title: Apple made more than $100 mln in commissions from 'Fortnite' - executive at trial
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) made more than $100 million in commissions from Epic Games' "Fortnite" during the two years the online game was on the App Store, an Apple executive testified on Wednesday.

Title: Ampere announces custom computing cores as it courts cloud customers
Short Description: Ampere Computing Llc, founded by former Intel Corp (INTC.O) President Renee James, said on Wednesday it will release a processor next year featuring its own custom-designed computing cores, joining a small group of custom chip companies that includes Apple Inc (AAPL.O).

Title: EU lawmaker wants stronger privacy rights in proposed EU tech rules
Short Description: Proposed EU rules targeting Facebook (FB.O), Google (GOOGL.O) and other large online platforms should include privacy rights for users as well as their right to anonymity, a key EU lawmaker steering the debate at the European Parliament said on Wednesday.

Title: EU proposes unified corporate tax regime fit for 21st century
Short Description: The European Union's executive on Tuesday adopted a plan for a more unified corporate tax regime across the bloc, whose 27 national systems are struggling to cope in a world where cross-border business, often via the Internet, is commonplace.

Title: Vietnam shuts industrial parks housing Foxconn plants after COVID-19 outbreak
Short Description: Vietnam's northern province of Bac Giang ordered on Tuesday four  industrial parks, including three that house production facilities of Taiwan's Foxconn (2317.TW), to temporarily shut down due to an outbreak of COVID-19.

Title: Berkshire sheds nearly all of Wells Fargo, a holding since 1989
Short Description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc (BRKa.N) has sold nearly all of its holdings in Wells Fargo & Co (WFC.N), as Warren Buffett abandoned a more than 31-year-old investment that had been among his most successful before the bank was felled by scandals for mistreating customers.

Title: Some big U.S. hedge funds loaded up on SPACS, value stocks during first quarter
Short Description: A number of well-known U.S. hedge funds bought value stocks and blank-check acquisition companies, selling some winners from the technology-led stock rally as bond yields rose during the first quarter, filings released on Monday showed.

Title: Apple's App Store chief kicks off iPhone maker's defense at Epic Games trial
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) on Monday began its formal defense in an antitrust trial brought by "Fortnite" online game creator Epic Games, by calling its App Store chief Phil Schiller to the stand.

Title: Parler returns to Apple’s App Store, names new CEO
Short Description: Parler, a social media app popular with U.S. conservatives, returned to Apple Inc 's App Store on Monday, after the iPhone maker dropped it following the deadly Jan. 6 riot at the U.S. Capitol.

Title: Amazon, Apple not to charge extra for lossless music
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN.O) and Apple Inc (AAPL.O) will let users stream high-quality lossless audio at no extra charge, as they explore new ways to keep subscribers tuned in to their services amid intense competition.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Goldman to launch Marcus UK robo-adviser early next year
Short Description: Goldman Sachs (GS.N) will launch an app for UK users of its digital bank Marcus over the following weeks and plans to offer automated investment management to clients in the country by the first quarter of next year.

Title: 'Chaos Monkeys' author calls Apple's statement on his departure defamatory
Short Description: An Apple Inc (AAPL.O) engineer who left the company this week after thousands of coworkers signed a petition calling for him to be sacked said on Twitter he was fired "in a snap decision" and that Apple made defamatory statements about him.

Title: Take Five: Retail, PMIs and a timely tantrum anniversary
Short Description: 1/ RETAIL HEAVEN

Title: Foxconn sees Q2 surge after profit leaps on COVID-19 work-from-home boom
Short Description: Taiwan's Foxconn (2317.TW) on Friday forecast a 15% rise in second-quarter revenue as the work-from-home boom spurred by the COVID-19 pandemic extends, boosting demand for consumer devices such as the iPhones that Foxconn assembles for Apple (AAPL.O).

Title: Apple supplier Foxconn reports Q1 profit T$28.2 bln, beats estimates
Short Description: Taiwan's Foxconn (2317.TW), which assembles iPhones for Apple (AAPL.O), on Friday reported better-than-expected first-quarter profit amid the work-from-home trend spurred by the COVID-19 pandemic that has stoked demand for electronic devices.

Title: Fisker finalizes deal with Foxconn to make EVs in U.S. starting in 2023
Short Description: Electric car maker Fisker Inc (FSR.N) has finalized its vehicle-assembly deal with Foxconn Technology Co Ltd (2354.TW), including plans to open a U.S. plant in 2023, the companies said on Thursday.

Title: Aeva announces customer deal; shares soar even after results disappoint
Short Description: Aeva Technologies Inc (AEVA.N)said on Thursday it signed a deal to develop a sensor for a self-driving car to be made by an "undisclosed large company," and its shares rose 13% even as it reported that its loss ballooned and sales came in far below forecasts.

Title: Madame Tussauds moves Prince Harry and Meghan waxworks from royals
Short Description: A year after leaving their royal duties to move to Los Angeles, Madame Tussauds has now decided waxwork models of Prince Harry and his wife Meghan now belong in the attraction's Hollywood zone and not with the other members of the House of Windsor.

Title: Foreign IT firms must open offices in Russia under new draft law - lawmaker
Short Description: Foreign technology companies will be forced to open offices in Russia or face penalties such as advertising bans under draft legislation, a senior lawmaker said on Thursday, in a fresh move by Moscow to exert greater control over Big Tech.

Title: Apple says 'Chaos Monkeys' author hired in ads business has left company
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) on Wednesday said Antonio García Martínez, a former Facebook Inc (FB.O) product manager who joined Apple recently to work in its advertising business, is no longer with the company.

Title: Capital Calls: Amazon EU tax win belongs to the past
Short Description: Concise insights on global finance.

Title: Wall St drops as strong inflation data fuels rate hike bets
Short Description: Wall Street's major indexes fell on Wednesday after stronger-than-expected inflation data stoked worries of tighter monetary policy to combat what many investors fear could be a prolonged period of inflation.

Title: Buyback to the future: pre-pandemic peak in sight
Short Description: Trillions of dollars stashed by U.S. and European companies during the coronavirus pandemic are starting to flow to shareholders, largely via buybacks, after a 2020 drought.

Title: Inflation woes push U.S. stocks to 1-month low, USD struggle
Short Description: U.S. stocks hit a one-month low on Tuesday as speculation that rising inflation pressure could prompt interest rate hikes sooner rather than later dragged on shares and hobbled the dollar, which hovered near a 2-1/2-month low.

Title: Google Pay launches international money transfers with Wise and Western Union
Short Description: Alphabet Inc's (GOOGL.O) Google has launched international money transfer partnerships with remittances firms Wise and Western Union Co (WU.N) for users of its U.S. payments app, the companies said on Tuesday.

Title: Tech giants join call for funding U.S. chip production
Short Description: Some of the world's biggest chip buyers, including Apple Inc (AAPL.O), Microsoft Corp (MSFT.O) and Alphabet Inc's (GOOGL.O) Google, are joining top chip-makers such as Intel Corp (INTC.O) to create a new lobbying group to press for government chip manufacturing subsidies.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Foxconn’s iPhone output in India down amid COVID surge-sources
Short Description: Production of the Apple iPhone 12 (AAPL.O) at a Foxconn (2317.TW) factory in India has slumped by more than 50% because workers infected with COVID-19 have had to leave their posts, two sources told Reuters.

Title: Capital Calls: French music IPO hits a minor key
Short Description: Concise insights on global finance.

Title: Lady Gaga, Glenn Close join Prince Harry and Oprah for mental health TV series
Short Description: Britain's Prince Harry and U.S. chat show queen Oprah Winfrey will premiere their television documentary series on mental health issues later this month, with singer Lady Gaga and actress Glenn Close among those contributing.

Title: Digital music company Believe plans Paris stock market debut
Short Description: Digital music company Believe, which scouts out singers and helps them to launch online, on Monday announced plans for a Paris stock market listing aiming to raise around 500 million euros ($608 million) to finance its expansion.

Title: Analysis: Fund managers see value, cyclical stocks running further despite slow U.S. jobs recovery
Short Description: While some technology stocks got a boost Friday after a disappointing U.S. jobs report, some portfolio managers say that blow-out earnings from several large technology companies over the last few weeks are not enough to keep making outsized bets on the sector.

Title: EXCLUSIVE India holds up wireless approvals for China-made devices, delaying launches
Short Description: India has held up approvals for import of wifi modules from China for months, driving companies such as U.S. computer makers Dell (DELL.N) and HP (HPQ.N) and China's Xiaomi (1810.HK), Oppo, Vivo and Lenovo (0992.HK) to delay product launches in a key growth market, two industry sources said.

Title: Self-driving startup Aeva says its sensor can detect vehicles over 500m away
Short Description: Self-driving sensor startup Aeva Technologies Inc (AEVA.N), founded by former Apple Inc (AAPL.O) engineers, said on Thursday its sensor can detect other vehicles from beyond 500 meters and pedestrians from a distance of more than 350 meters.

Title: IBM unveils 2-nanometer chip technology for faster computing
Short Description: For decades, each generation of computer chips got faster and more power-efficient because their most basic building blocks, called transistors, got smaller.

Title: EXCLUSIVE China's Tencent in talks with U.S. to keep gaming investments -sources
Short Description: Tencent Holdings Ltd (0700.HK) is negotiating agreements with a U.S. national security panel that would allow it to keep its ownership stakes in U.S. video game developers Riot Games and Epic Games, according to people familiar with the matter.

Title: Judge presses Epic CEO during second day of Apple antitrust trial
Short Description: A U.S. judge on Tuesday pressed the chief executive of "Fortnite" creator Epic Games on how the fundamental changes the game maker is asking her to force on Apple Inc's (AAPL.O) App Store would affect the livelihoods of millions of developers who make software for Apple devices.

Title: Nasdaq plunges more than 2% as investors dump growth stocks
Short Description: The Nasdaq fell more than 2% on Tuesday as steep declines in megacap growth stocks pushed Wall Street below record trading levels, with investors seeking shelter in more defensive parts of the market.

Title: Supply chain bottlenecks amid roaring demand slow U.S. manufacturing
Short Description: U.S. manufacturing activity grew at a slower pace in April,  restrained by shortages of inputs as rising vaccinations against COVID-19 and massive fiscal stimulus unleashed pent-up demand.

Title: Epic Games CEO cites Apple’s ‘total control’ over iPhones at first day of antitrust trial
Short Description: The chief executive of "Fortnite" creator Epic Games testified on Monday that he knew he was breaking Apple Inc's (AAPL.O) App Store rules by putting Epic's own in-app payment system into the game last year but wanted to highlight Apple's sway over the world's iPhone users, which now total 1 billion.

Title: S&P 500, Dow start month on strong footing, growth stocks lag
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow indexes rose on Monday as a largely upbeat earnings season strengthened expectations of sustained profit growth, while the Nasdaq came under pressure from declines in some high-flying growth stocks.

Title: Buffett and Munger heap criticism on Robinhood for casino-like atmosphere
Short Description: Warren Buffett on Saturday likened the millions of inexperienced day traders who entered the stock market in the past year to gamblers, and said commission-free brokerages such as Robinhood Financial for promoted a casino-like atmosphere.

Title: Buffett's Berkshire rebounds from pandemic's depths, buys back more stock
Short Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc (BRKa.N) said on Saturday its earnings are rebounding from the worst effects of the COVID-19 pandemic and that it has extended its aggressive stock repurchases with $6.6 billion of new buybacks.

Title: Berkshire operating profit rises, buys back more stock
Short Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc (BRKa.N) on Saturday said first-quarter operating profit rose 20%, and that it extended its recent aggressive stock repurchases by buying back $6.6 billion of its own stock.

Title: Wall St Week Ahead Blow-out U.S. earnings suggest market has room to run
Short Description: U.S. companies are leaping above expectations on first-quarter earnings, giving investors stronger confirmation that profit growth will be able to support the market this year.

Title: Wall Street ends lower, weighed down by Apple
Short Description: Wall Street ended lower on Friday, with Apple, Alphabet and other tech-related companies weighing on the S&P 500 and Nasdaq despite recent strong quarterly earnings reports.

Title: Apple and Alphabet pull Wall Street lower
Short Description: Wall Street dropped on Friday, with Apple, Alphabet and other tech-related companies dipping despite recent strong quarterly earnings reports.

Title: S&P 500 falls, still on track for third straight month of gains
Short Description: The S&P 500 fell in early afternoon trading on Friday, after a slew of strong quarterly earnings and upbeat economic data put the benchmark index on track for a third straight month of gains.

Title: Factbox: U.S. tech giants in the EU antitrust crosshairs
Short Description: Apple (AAPL.O) was charged by EU antitrust regulators on Friday of abusing its dominance in the music streaming market via restrictive rules in response to a complaint brought by Spotify Technology (SPOT.N).

Title: EU hits Apple with music streaming charge in boost for Spotify
Short Description: EU regulators accused Apple (AAPL.O) on Friday of distorting competition in the music streaming market, siding with Spotify (SPOT.N) in a case that could lead to a hefty fine and changes in the iPhone maker's lucrative business practices.

Title: EU to charge Apple over its in-app payment system rules -source
Short Description: Antitrust regulators will on Friday charge iPhone Apple (AAPL.O) with anti-competitive behaviour by not allowing developers to inform users of other purchasing options outside of apps, a person familiar with the matter said.

Title: Work from home boosts Taiwan's economic growth to fastest in over a decade
Short Description: Taiwan's economy grew at its fastest pace in more than a decade in the first three months of 2021 as the "work from home" boom sparked strong global demand for the island's hi-tech exports.

Title: EU's Vestager to hold news conference, Apple in focus
Short Description: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager will hold a news conference at 11:00 GMT, the European Commission said on Friday, when she is expected to charge iPhone maker Apple (AAPL.O) for anti-competitive practices on its App Store.

Title: Twitter breaks tech’s blockbuster streak, shares fall on tepid outlook
Short Description: Twitter Inc (TWTR.N) shares sank 11% in post-market trading on Thursday as it offered tepid revenue guidance for the second quarter, warned of rising costs and expenses and said user growth could slow as the boost seen during the coronavirus pandemic fizzles.

Title: Facebook fuels S&P 500 to record high close
Short Description: The S&P 500 closed at a record high on Thursday, fueled by gains in Facebook following its strong earnings report, while investors awaited upcoming results from Amazon.

Title: Berkshire annual meeting to showcase Munger as he rejoins Buffett
Short Description: Berkshire Hathaway Inc's (BRKa.N) widely anticipated annual meeting on Saturday will be held virtually for a second year  but reclaim one bit of normalcy as Charlie Munger rejoins fellow billionaire Warren Buffett to answershareholder questions.

Title: Blocking Google class action would deny justice, UK court told
Short Description: Blocking a proposed British class action against Google (GOOGL.O), that alleges it secretly tracked millions of iPhone users a decade ago, risks allowing big firms to behave with impunity, a lawyer told the Supreme Court on Thursday.

Title: Germany's financial watchdog warns crypto exchange Binance over "stock tokens"
Short Description: Germany's financial regulator BaFin warned that Binance, one of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchanges, risked being fined for offering its securities-tracking digital tokens without publishing an investor prospectus.

Title: S&P 500 near record high on Facebook boost, Nasdaq eases
Short Description: The S&P 500 hovered near record highs on Thursday, helped by gains in Facebook and upbeat economic data, while the Nasdaq eased as investors locked in profits from certain megacap technology firms.

Title: French watchdog warns of big tech's sway over payment services
Short Description: Digital payment services developed by U.S. tech giants such as Apple (AAPL.O) and Alphabet's Google (GOOGL.O) risk reinforcing their market power by giving them greater sway over consumers' data, France's antitrust authority said on Thursday.

Title: Samsung overtakes Apple in smartphone shipments as Xiaomi closes in
Short Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd (005930.KS) reclaimed its crown as the world's biggest smartphone maker from Apple (AAPL.O) in the first quarter, cornering a fifth of overall global shipments.

Title: Asia shares extend gains on supportive Fed, Biden's stimulus
Short Description: Asian shares extended gains on Thursday after the Federal Reserve said it was too early to consider rolling back emergency support for the economy, and U.S. President Joe Biden proposed an $1.8 trillion stimulus package.

Title: Huawei cedes further ground as smaller smartphone rivals swoop in
Short Description: Smartphone shipments at China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd (HWT.UL), once the world's biggest smartphone maker, halved in the first quarter in China, as U.S. sanctions choked its supply chain even as the overall smartphone market rebounded.

Title: Asia shares rise on supportive Fed as Biden unveils new stimulus
Short Description: Asian shares rose in early trade on Thursday after the U.S. Federal Reserve said it was too early to consider rolling back emergency support for the economy, and as U.S. President Joe Biden unveiled plans for a $1.8 trillion stimulus package.

Title: Apple soars past sales, profit targets, warns of chip shortages
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) on Wednesday posted sales and profits ahead of Wall Street expectations fueled by 5G iPhone upgrades but warned a global chip shortage could dent iPads and Mac sales by several billion dollars.

Title: Qualcomm sees revenue, profits above estimates as supply chain improves
Short Description: Qualcomm Inc (QCOM.O) on Wednesday forecast current-quarter sales and adjusted profits above Wall Street estimates, with executives saying they see supply constraints easing as smartphone buyers upgrade to 5G and former Huawei Technologies Co Ltd (HWT.UL) customers migrate to Qualcomm-chip phones.

Title: Analysis: For Google, plenty of cash with nowhere to go
Short Description: In announcing a $50-billion share buyback on Tuesday, Google-owner Alphabet Inc (GOOGL.O) confirmed a paradoxical dynamic: its core advertising business is so profitable, and so dominant, that it has few options for usefully deploying its cash.

Title: Wall Street mixed after Fed holds steady on rate policy
Short Description: Wall Street was mixed on Wednesday after the U.S. Federal Reserve held interest rates and its monthly bond-buying program steady and gave no sign it was ready to reduce its support for the recovery.

Title: S&P 500 flat after Fed holds steady on rates
Short Description: The S&P 500 was flat on Wednesday after the U.S. Federal Reserve held interest rates and its monthly bond-buying program steady and gave no sign it was ready to reduce its support for the recovery.

Title: Google battles landmark UK class action over alleged iPhone tracking
Short Description: A proposed multi-billion pound British class action against Google (GOOGL.O), which alleges the internet giant secretly tracked millions of iPhone users, is not viable and should not be allowed to proceed, the Supreme Court was told on Wednesday.

Title: Spotify shares fall after muted paid subscriber growth forecast
Short Description: Shares of Spotify Technology SA (SPOT.N) fell 8% in pre-market trading on Wednesday after its forecast of subdued current quarter paid subscriber numbers overshadowed upbeat first-quarter growth in countries such as the United States and India.

Title: Dow, Nasdaq weighed down by Microsoft, Amgen; all eyes on Fed
Short Description: The Dow and Nasdaq indexes fell on Wednesday as Amgen and Microsoft weighed, while investors focused on a Federal Reserve meeting for updates on monetary policy and waited for another batch of earnings from big technology firms.

Title: Spotify forecasts weak quarter as subscriber growth falters
Short Description: Spotify Technology SA (SPOT.N) on Wednesday forecast current quarter paid subscribers below Wall Street estimates, after its first-quarter results beat expectations driven by growth in countries such as the United States and India.

Title: Asian stocks seesaw as traders hold breath before Fed meeting
Short Description: Asian shares struggled to make firm gains on Wednesday as already high valuations discouraged investors from buying equities ahead of a closely-watched U.S. Federal Reserve meeting.

Title: Asian shares mixed as earnings fail to inspire before Fed
Short Description: Asian shares were mixed on Wednesday as already high valuations discouraged investors from buying equities ahead of a closely-watched U.S. Federal Reserve meeting.

Title: Regulation may be needed for Apple, Google app stores if changes not made - Australian regulator
Short Description: Australia's competition watchdog said on Wednesday regulation may be required to address the significant market power app stores owned by Alphabet's Google (GOOGL.O) and Apple (AAPL.O) have if they do not take steps to assuage concerns.

Title: SK Hynix speeds up spending but warns tight chip supply to persist
Short Description: SK Hynix (000660.KS), the world's No.2 memory chip maker, said on Wednesday it will bring forward planned capital spending but warned supply increases from the investment will come only next year, pointing to a prolonged global semiconductor shortage.

Title: Wall Street ends mostly flat ahead of earnings wave
Short Description: Tepid results from Tesla and 3M weighed on Wall Street on Tuesday, with the S&P 500 and Dow ending near flat as investors focused on wave of earnings reports from Microsoft, Alphabet and other corporate heavyweights.

Title: Wall Street ends mixed as earnings wave nears
Short Description: Tepid results from Tesla and 3M weighed on Wall Street on Tuesday, with the main indexes ending mixed as investors focused on wave of earnings reports from Microsoft, Alphabet and other corporate heavyweights.

Title: Wall Street treads water as earnings wave nears
Short Description: Tepid results from Tesla and 3M weighed on Wall Street on Tuesday as investors focused on an approaching wave of earnings reports from Microsoft, Alphabet and other corporate heavyweights.

Title: EU to hit Apple with antitrust charge this week -source
Short Description: EU antitrust regulators are set to charge iPhone maker Apple (AAPL.O) this week with blocking rivals on its App Store following a complaint by music streaming service Spotify (SPOT.N), a person familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Title: Arm details new data center chips, says Oracle, Alibaba will use them
Short Description: Arm Ltd, the British chip technology firm being acquired by Nvidia Corp (NVDA.O) in a $40 billion deal, on Tuesday gave new details about its next generation of data center technology and said Oracle Corp (ORCL.N) and Alibaba Group Holding (9988.HK) will use the chips.

Title: Wall Street dips as Tesla, 3M weigh; big tech earnings in focus
Short Description: Lackluster results from Tesla and 3M dragged Wall Street's main indexes lower on Tuesday, shifting investor focus to earnings from big technology companies, including Microsoft and Alphabet, later in the day.

Title: Russia fines Apple $12 mln for alleged app market abuse
Short Description: Russia said it had fined Apple  $12 million for alleged abuse of its dominance in the mobile applications market, in the latest dispute between Moscow and a Western technology firm.

Title: Spotify launches podcast subscription platform to challenge Apple
Short Description: Spotify (SPOT.N) launched on Tuesday a paid subscription platform for podcasters in the United States and plans to expand in other regions in the coming months, a week after Apple (AAPL.O) unveiled a similar service.

Title: S&P 500, Nasdaq close at record highs ahead of technology earnings wave
Short Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed at record highs on Monday, fueled by Tesla Inc and other heavyweight growth stocks ahead of a deluge of earnings reports this week.

Title: S&P 500, Nasdaq close at record highs ahead of tech earnings wave
Short Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed at record highs on Monday, fueled by Tesla Inc ahead of the electric car maker's quarterly report, the first of several this week from heavyweight growth companies.

Title: Impact of Apple ad tracking changes will hinge on app developers, exec says
Short Description: The impact of Apple Inc's (AAPL.O) new privacy controls over digital advertising tracking is likely to depend greatly on how app developers implement a new pop-up notification, Apple's user privacy chief told Reuters.

Title: Tesla lifts S&P 500 ahead of tech earnings wave
Short Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq climbed on Monday, fueled by Tesla ahead of the electric car maker's quarterly report, which kicks off this week's results from several heavyweight growth companies.

Title: German business groups file complaint over Apple privacy settings
Short Description: Germany's media, internet and advertising industries on Monday filed an antitrust complaint against Apple Inc (AAPL.O), alleging that new iPhone privacy settings represent a market abuse and a violation of competition law.

Title: Former Apple CEO John Sculley's Zeta Global files for U.S. IPO
Short Description: Zeta Global Holdings Corp, a marketing software firm co-founded by former Apple Inc (AAPL.O) Chief Executive Officer John Sculley, has filed paperwork for a U.S. initial public offering, according to a regulatory filing by the company on Monday.

Title: Apple iPhone privacy update seen hurting Facebook revenue in Q2
Short Description: When Facebook Inc (FB.O) reports first quarter earnings on Wednesday, investors will be preoccupied with how a new pop-up privacy notification on Apple's (AAPL.O) iPhones will affect the second quarter.

Title: Explainer: What do Apple's new iPhone privacy changes mean for consumers and businesses?
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) on Monday will begin rolling out an update of its iOS operating system with new privacy controls designed to limit digital advertisers from tracking iPhone users.

Title: Spotify's new tie-up to allow listeners play music, podcasts from Facebook app
Short Description: Spotify (SPOT.N) on Monday said it has partnered with Facebook (FB.O) to allow listeners to play music and podcasts directly from the social network's iOS and Android apps.

Title: Apple to establish North Carolina campus, increase U.S. spending targets
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) on Monday said it will establish a new campus in North Carolina that will house up to 3,000 employees, expand its operations in several other U.S. states and increase its spending targets with U.S. suppliers.

Title: Tesla lifts Wall Street as big tech earnings set to roll in
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes rose on Monday as electric-car maker Tesla gained ahead its earnings report, kicking off this week's results from heavyweight technology companies.

Title: Analysis: Retail trading appetite robust even as stock-buying frenzy cools
Short Description: Retail traders have shifted from "meme stocks" to large-cap names and exchange traded funds, and while their activity has eased from its January peak, the blistering pace of new retail account openings means non-professionals are likely to remain a market force.

Title: Apple to help workers get COVID-19 shots at its offices
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) said on Friday that it is starting a program to help employees get voluntary COVID-19 vaccinations at the iPhone maker's offices.

Title: Take Five: V-shaped virus rebound
Short Description: 1/COVID COMEBACK

Title: After blazing U.S. stock rally, some warn of tougher market ahead
Short Description:
Some of Wall Street's biggest names are predicting a pause in a rally that has taken the S&P 500 (.SPX)
                to fresh records this year, leaving investors trying to determine whether to lock in some of the breathtaking gains or stay the course.

Title: Technology, high-growth stocks could lose out from Biden's capital gains tax plan
Short Description: Wall Street is skeptical President Joe Biden's expected proposal to hike capital gains taxes could pass the Senate, but investors see risks that tax-motivated selling could still weigh on technology and other sectors that skyrocketed during the pandemic.

Title: Analysis: Low-tax Ireland plays damage limitation card as global overhaul beckons
Short Description: Ireland, resigned to having much to lose from a global overhaul of how multinational companies are taxed, has embarked on a damage limitation exercise that it hopes will let it and other low-tax economies retain some of their decades-old advantages.

Title: Apple plans to expand ads business - FT
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) is planning to expand its advertising business by adding a second advertising slot in its App Store search page's "suggested" section, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.

Title: Encrypted chat app Signal alleges flaws in Cellebrite equipment
Short Description: Encrypted chat app Signal suggested in a blog post published on Wednesday that products sold to law enforcement from Israeli surveillance provider Cellebrite can easily be sabotaged.

Title: Facebook tweaks ad tools ahead of Apple's privacy changes
Short Description: Facebook Inc (FB.O) said on Wednesday it is making changes to its advertising tools to comply with an upcoming privacy update by Apple Inc (AAPL.O), limiting the effectiveness of data collection features used by advertisers.

Title: Epic CEO, Apple App Store chief to attend antitrust trial starting May 3
Short Description: Epic Games Chief Executive Tim Sweeney will attend a weeks-long antitrust trial against Apple Inc (AAPL.O), while the iPhone maker's App Store chief Phil Schiller will be present, attorneys for each of the companies said on Wednesday.

Title: Apple supplier Quanta says no business impact from ransomware attack
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) supplier Quanta Computer Inc (2382.TW) said on Wednesday it does not expect any material business impact from a ransomware attack, after media reports that a Russian hacker group had accessed confidential data from the Taiwan-based contract manufacturer's servers.

Title: U.S. senators question Apple and Google on app store dominance
Short Description: A panel of U.S. senators questioned officials from Apple Inc (AAPL.O) and Alphabet Inc's (GOOGL.O) Google on Wednesday about the dominance of their mobile app stores and whether the companies abuse their power at the expense of smaller competitors.

Title: How a sweetheart deal gives GameStop CEO a $179 mln goodbye gift
Short Description: Gamestop Corp (GME.N) chief executive George Sherman can step down this summer with a $179 million windfall that dwarfs CEO salaries at many larger corporations thanks to a sweetheart deal that was turbocharged by this year's furious meme stock rally, compensation experts said.

Title: Bain Capital considering bid to take Toshiba private -sources
Short Description: Bain Capital is looking at formulating a bid to acquire Toshiba Corp (6502.T), two people familiar with the matter said, making it one of several firms said to be interested in taking the Japanese conglomerate private.

Title: Factbox: Top six takeaways from Apple's spring event
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) on Tuesday announced AirTags, its long-rumored device tracker, a new line of iMac computers and iPad tablets with its own processors and a podcast subscription service.

Title: Apple’s new AirTags could factor into U.S. Senate antitrust hearing
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) on Tuesday announced the launch of attachable AirTags to help users track lost items, and the devices could become the focus of a rival company's challenge during a hearing before the U.S. Senate on Wednesday.

Title: Apple goes to battle with Spotify in premium podcast push
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) is fighting to retain control of the fast-growing podcasting market it popularized years ago but did not monetize, analysts and industry experts told Reuters.

Title: Church leaders call for Home Depot boycott over Georgia voting curbs
Short Description: Black religious leaders in Georgia representing more than 1,000 churches called on Tuesday for a boycott of Home Depot Inc (HD.N), accusing the home improvement giant of failing to take a stand against the state's new Republican-backed curbs on voting.

Title: Apple packs iPad Pros with faster chips, slims iMacs and jumps into tracking tags
Short Description: Apple Inc (AAPL.O) announced on Tuesday a range of new computers, a paid podcasting service and devices for finding lost items, signaling the continued expansion of its once-simple product line into more and more corners of customers' lives.

Title: Investors turn to growth stocks' results after strong earnings start
Short Description: On the heels of blockbuster earnings from major U.S. banks, investors are focused on whether an upcoming batch of earnings from major technology-related companies can sustain the season's early momentum.

Title: Google, Apple executives to testify in app store hearing on Wednesday

Title: Apple aims to make 30% more iPhones in first half of 2021 - Nikkei

Title: Apple supplier Wistron puts India plant damage at up to $7 million
Short Description: The ransacking of an iPhone manufacturing facility in India caused up to T$200 million ($7.12 million) in damage though production facilities were not as badly hit as reported, its Taiwan-based operator Wistron Corp said on Tuesday.

Title: Apple starts applying new data privacy labels to apps
Short Description: Apple Inc on Monday said it had begun the rollout of new labels about the privacy practices of apps for users to see before they are downloaded from its App Store.

Title: Tech giants could be fined 10% of turnover for breaching EU rules -EU source
Short Description: Tech giants which control access and data to their platforms will face fines of up to 10% of their annual turnover for violations under draft EU rules to be announced on Tuesday, a person familiar with the matter said.

Title: Apple probes supplier after workers at Wistron plant in India rampage
Short Description: Apple Inc said on Monday it is investigating whether a Taiwan contractor, Wistron Corp, flouted supplier guidelines at an iPhone manufacturing facility in India, after some workers ransacked the plant in a protest over unpaid wages.

Title: Apple CEO calls for stricter corporate, government climate goals at U.N. summit
Short Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook on Saturday called on governments and businesses to implement stronger climate targets starting next year, during remarks at the United Nations' Climate Ambition Summit.

Title: Apple CEO calls for stricter corporate, government climate goals at U.N. summit
Short Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook on Saturday called on governments and businesses to implement stronger climate targets starting next year, during remarks at the United Nations' Climate Ambition Summit.

Short Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook on Saturday called on governments and businesses to implement stronger climate targets starting next year, during remarks at the United Nations' Climate Ambition Summit.

Title: US STOCKS Stimulus uncertainty hems in Wall St; Disney soars
Short Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed with modest declines on Friday, as uncertainty over fresh economic stimulus dented confidence, although strong gains from Walt Disney helped the Dow Industrials eke out a gain.

Title: US STOCKS Stimulus uncertainty holds Wall St in check; Disney soars
Short Description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq were lower on Friday, as uncertainty over fresh economic stimulus dented confidence, although strong gains from Walt Disney helped keep the Dow Industrials afloat.

Title: Exxon faces proxy fight launched by new activist firm Engine No. 1
Short Description: A new investment firm is taking aim at one of corporate America's most iconic brands, pressing energy giant Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) to overhaul itself by focusing more on clean energy to improve its financial performance.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St slips on rising coronavirus cases, Tesla drags Nasdaq lower
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow fell on Tuesday as surging COVID-19  cases and strict restrictions in California threatened to further weigh on an already stalling economic recovery, while losses in Tesla pulled the Nasdaq off its record high.

Title: Analysis: EU sees no abrupt end to Trump tariffs when Biden takes charge
Short Description: When EU leaders gather this week for their last summit of the Donald Trump era, expect fulsome declarations of hope for a renewed transatlantic alliance under Joe Biden, but rather less to be said about a sudden end to Trump's trade war.

Title: Apple is sued by rival over alleged App Store monopoly
Short Description: Apple Inc was sued on Thursday by the creator of a once-popular app store that accused the iPhone maker of illegally monopolizing software distribution on its own operating system.

Title: Apple CEO Tim Cook to speak at U.N. summit on anniversary of Paris climate accords
Short Description: Apple Inc Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook plans to deliver remarks at the United Nations' Climate Ambition Summit on Dec. 12, the company confirmed on Wednesday.

Title: Apple could block apps that don't comply with new privacy feature
Short Description: Apple threatened on Tuesday to remove apps from its widely-used App Store if they don't comply with an upcoming private feature allowing users to block advertisers from tracking them across different applications.

Title: Apple launches $549 new AirPods Max to boost holiday sales; delivery times face delays
Short Description: Apple Inc on Tuesday unveiled its new AirPods Max, a set of wireless over-ear headphones, at $549 apiece, pricier than some of its other popular phone and tablet products, in a measure aimed at boosting sales over the December holiday period.

Title: Amazon brings macOS to cloud in a boost to Apple app developers
Short Description: Amazon.com Inc will run Apple Inc's macOS on its cloud service for the first time, allowing app developers for Apple's devices to access the operating system on demand, the company's cloud unit Amazon Web Services said on Monday.

Title: Italy's antitrust fines Apple 10 million euros for  misleading commercial practices
Short Description: Italy's antitrust authority said on Monday it had fined Apple 10 million euros ($12 million) for "aggressive and misleading" commercial practices regarding its iPhones.

Title: Exclusive: Foxconn to shift some Apple production to Vietnam to minimise China risk
Short Description: Foxconn is moving some iPad and MacBook assembly to Vietnam from China at the request of Apple Inc, said a person with knowledge of the plan, as the U.S. firm diversifies production to minimise the impact of a Sino-U.S. trade war.

Title: Apple's security chief accused of bribery in California gun-permit probe
Short Description: Apple Inc's security chief on Monday was indicted on bribery charges as prosecutors alleged he promised a donation of 200 iPads to the Santa Clara County Sheriff's Office to secure four concealed-weapon permits for Apple employees.

Title: Apple extends concession on store fees for some apps
Short Description: Apple Inc AAPL.O> said https://developer.apple.com/news/?id=kw16tplo on Monday apps that offer virtual sessions or classes do not need to use App Store's in-app purchase method through June, extending an earlier deadline of December.

Title: Apple grants CEO Tim Cook first major stock package since 2011

Title: U.S. judge urges Apple, Epic Games to put antitrust claims before jury

Title: Apple says has always abided by Irish law as EU appeals court ruling
Short Description: IPhone maker Apple on Friday said it has always complied with Irish tax laws and that the issue which led to an EU tax order of 13 billion euros ($15 billion) was more a case of where it should pay taxes rather than the amount.

Title: EU's Vestager appeals court veto of $15 billion Apple tax order

Short Description: Apple Inc will launch its first online store in India on Sept. 23, the iPhone maker said on Friday, coinciding with the country's holiday season that brings some of the biggest sales for retailers every year.

Title: Apple preparing 75 million 5G iPhones for later this year: Bloomberg

Title: Microsoft says Apple's move against 'Fortnite' creator would hurt its games
Short Description: Microsoft Corp <MSFT.O> on Sunday said in a court filing that Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> threat to cut off the creator of "Fortnite" from Apple's developer tools would hurt Microsoft's gaming business, as well as other game developers.

Title: REFILE-Microsoft says Apple's move against 'Fortnite' creator would hurt its games
Short Description: Microsoft Corp on Sunday said in a court filing that Apple Inc's threat to cut off the creator of "Fortnite" from Apple's developer tools would hurt Microsoft's gaming business, as well as other game developers.

Title: Apple says 'Fortnite' maker wanted 'side letter' to create own game store
Short Description: Apple Inc on Friday alleged that Epic Games' chief executive had asked it for a "side letter" to create its own game store within the iPhone maker's App Store, which Apple said would have upended the store's commission-based business model.

Title: News publishers push back against Apple over app store terms
Short Description: Major news publishers are seeking more favorable terms from Apple Inc <AAPL.O> on commissions the iPhone maker collects from them on payments made through its app store, according to a letter posted by a trade body on Thursday.

Title: U.S. trade panel launches patent infringement probe into Apple devices
Short Description: The U.S. International Trade Commission said it has launched a Section 337 investigation into whether certain Apple Inc mobile devices and laptop computers infringed patents held by Japan's Maxell Holdings.

Title: Apple's stock market value tops $2 trillion
Short Description: Just two years after Apple became the first publicly listed U.S. company with a $1 trillion stock market value, the iPhone maker has now topped $2 trillion.

Title: Apple briefly tops $2 trillion in market value
Short Description: Apple Inc became the first publicly listed U.S. company with a $2 trillion stock market value on Wednesday, as Wall Street investors put aside challenges to its iPhone ecosystem in favor of bets it will only prosper more in the post-coronavirus world. (Reporting by Noel...

Title: Taiwan-based Apple supplier Catcher to sell two divisions to China's Lens for $1.4 billion
Short Description: Taiwan-based Catcher Technology <2474.TW>, a supplier to Apple Inc <AAPL.O>, has agreed to sell two units from its Lyra International division in China to Hunan-based Lens Technology Co <300433.SZ> for $1.43 billion, a company filing showed.

Title: Epic Games asks judge to block Apple's removal of 'Fortnite' from app store
Short Description: Epic Games said on Monday it was seeking to block Apple Inc's removal of "Fortnite" from its app store and has asked a judge to prevent any retaliatory action against its other games in the store.

Title: Apple expands independent repair shop program to Mac computers
Short Description: (This Aug 17 story fixes reversed words in title of Public Interest Research Group in paragraph 7.)

Title: 'Fortnite' app removal threatens social lifeline for young gamers
Short Description: A YouTube alert interrupted Jack Erricker’s schoolwork on Friday morning as he and kids all over the world woke up to the news that their favorite game, Fortnite, had been taken down from Apple’s Store and Google Play store.

Title: In lawsuit, 'Fortnite' maker to test idea of iPhone as market unto itself
Short Description: 'Fortnite' maker Epic Games has launched the most significant effort yet to advance the legal theory that Apple's iPhone ecosystem has become so "sticky" that it is a distinct software market over which Apple exercises monopoly power.

Title: Facebook bashes Apple for refusing to waive commission fees, seizing on backlash
Short Description: Facebook Inc <FB.O> said on Friday that Apple Inc <AAPL.O> had declined its request to waive a 30% commission fee the iPhone maker charges apps listed on iOS devices, taking a shot at its fellow Big Tech peer as developers challenge the policy.

Title: Epic Games wins support from 'Fortnite' gamers, firms on Apple standoff
Short Description: "Fortnite" creator Epic Games found support from its legions of gamers, Tinder-owner Match Group and Spotify for suing Apple and Google after the tech giants dropped the popular video game from their app stores for violating payment guidelines.

Title: Apple's famous '1984' video parodied by Fortnite game maker
Short Description: Fortnite maker Epic Games has used a famous Apple advertisement against the iPhone maker in a social media campaign accompanying a legal battle it launched on Thursday.

Title: Fortnite maker sues Apple, Google after removal of game from app stores
Short Description: Apple Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google on Thursday removed popular video game "Fortnite" from their app stores for violating the in-app payment guidelines, prompting developer Epic Games to file federal antitrust lawsuits challenging their rules.

Title: Apple removes Fortnite game from App Store
Short Description: Apple Inc said on Thursday it removed popular video game Fortnite from its App Store after developer Epic Games enabled a direct payment feature that violated the iPhone maker's in-app payment guidelines.

Title: Apple readies subscription bundles to boost services: Bloomberg News
Short Description: Apple Inc is readying a series of subscription bundles that will let customers sign in for several of the iPhone maker's digital services at a lower monthly price, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.

Title: Facebook, Microsoft gripes with Apple's App Store on EU's antitrust radar
Short Description: Facebook <FB.O> and Microsoft's <MSFT.O> grievances over how their gaming apps appear on Apple's <AAPL.O> App Store may feed into an EU investigation into the iPhone maker's business as EU antitrust regulators said such concerns are on their radar.

Title: New Zealand records 100 days without domestic virus case but warns against complacency
Short Description: New Zealand marked 100 days without a domestic transmission of the coronavirus on Sunday, but warned against complacency as countries like Vietnam and Australia which once had the virus under control now battle a resurgence in infections.

Title: New Zealand records 100 days without domestic virus case but warns against complacency
Short Description: New Zealand marked 100 days without a domestic transmission of the coronavirus on Sunday, but warned against complacency as countries like Vietnam and Australia which once had the virus under control now battle a resurgence in infections.

Title: Chinese artificial intelligence company files $1.4 billion lawsuit against Apple
Short Description: Chinese artificial intelligence company Shanghai Zhizhen Intelligent Network Technology Co Ltd, also known as Xiao-i, has filed a lawsuit against Apple Inc, alleging it has infringed on its patents.

Title: Apple removes thousands of game apps from China store: research firm
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.N> removed 29,800 apps from its Chinese app store on Saturday, including more than 26,000 games, according to data from research firm Qimai.

Title: Apple tops Saudi Aramco as most valuable publicly listed company
Short Description: Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> surged over 10% to a record high on Friday after reporting blockbuster quarterly results, helping the iPhone maker eclipse Saudi Aramco to become the world's most valuable publicly listed company.

Title: Apple briefly overtakes Saudi Aramco to become the world's largest company
Short Description: Apple Inc shares surged as much as 7.1% to a record high on Friday after reporting blockbuster quarterly results, helping the iPhone maker briefly overtake Saudi Aramco to become the world's largest public company.

Title: Apple loyalists prove physical stores not needed to drive iPhone sales: J.P. Morgan
Short Description: Apple customer loyalty and response to the COVID-19 pandemic have proven brick-and-mortar stores are not essential to drive sales of its products, J.P.Morgan said on Friday, as the iPhone maker's blockbuster quarterly results pushed its shares up 7%.

Title: Apple's stock split may not be good for the Dow
Short Description: Apple <AAPL.O> announced a stock split on Thursday and it may not bode well for future gains in the Dow Jones Industrial Average <.DJI>.

Title: Apple delivers blowout earnings amid COVID-19, market shrugs off iPhone delays
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> on Thursday delivered blowout quarterly results, reporting revenue gains across every category and in every geography as consumers working and learning from home during the COVID-19 pandemic turned to its products and services.

Title: Exclusive: Arizona leads multi-state probe into older iPhones slowing, shutting down
Short Description: Arizona is leading a multi-U.S. state investigation into whether Apple Inc's deliberate slowing of older iPhones violated deceptive trade practice laws, documents reviewed by Reuters on Wednesday showed.

Title: Can Apple's 24X7 services store-front make up for falling iPhone sales?
Short Description: Many of Apple Inc's physical stores re-opened and re-closed in recent months because of spikes in cases of the novel coronavirus.

Title: App Store chief says Apple aimed to level playing field for developers
Short Description: On Wednesday, Apple Inc Chief Executive Tim Cook will face questions from U.S. lawmakers about whether the iPhone maker's App Store practices give it unfair power over independent software developers.

Title: Apple faces deceptive trade practices probe by multiple U.S. states: document
Short Description: Multiple U.S. states are investigating Apple Inc for potentially deceiving consumers, according to a March document obtained by a tech watchdog group.

Title: Apple to remove carbon from supply chain, products by 2030
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said on Tuesday it plans to remove carbon emissions from its entire business, including its products and sprawling supply chain, over the next decade.

Title: Apple expands coding education programs to more historically Black schools
Short Description: Apple Inc said on Thursday it was working with 10 additional historically Black universities and colleges to become "hubs" that will teach computer programming and app design skills in their regions.

Title: Apple expands news offerings with audio, local newspaper stories
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> on Wednesday expanded its news offerings with audio versions of stories narrated by voice actors for subscribers, a morning newscast hosted by two journalists and more access to local newspaper stories.

Title: Policymakers will tread carefully on tax reform after Apple ruling, says Ireland's Donohoe
Short Description: Policymakers will pay greater care to the legal foundations of corporate tax reforms after an EU order for Apple to pay 13 billion euros ($14.9 billion) in Irish back taxes was rejected in court, Ireland's finance minister said on Wednesday.

Title: No time frame for any possible Apple appeal, EU Commission says
Short Description: The European Commission could not say on Wednesday how long it might take to decide whether or not to appeal an earlier court tax ruling on iPhone maker Apple, a spokeswoman for the EU executive told reporters.

Title: EU's Vestager vows to continue tax fight after Apple setback
Short Description: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager vowed on Wednesday to continue her fight against tax measures used by multinationals despite a setback dealt by Europe's second-top court, which earlier scrapped her 13 billion euro tax order to Apple.

Title: Apple welcomes court ruling against EU tax order
Short Description: Apple said on Wednesday that it was pleased that Europe's second-top court had rejected an EU order to the iPhone maker to pay 13 billion euros ($14.78 billion) in Irish back taxes.

Title: Ireland welcomes annulling of EU Apple tax order
Short Description: Ireland welcomed the judgment by Europe's second-top court on Wednesday to reject a European Union order that iPhone maker Apple pay 13 billion euros ($14.78 billion) in Irish back taxes.

Title: Blow for EU as Apple wins fight against $15 billion tax order
Short Description: Apple scored a major win on Wednesday as Europe's second-highest court rejected an EU order for the iPhone maker to pay 13 billion euros ($15 billion) in Irish back taxes, dealing a blow to the bloc's attempts to crack down on sweetheart tax deals.

Title: Over 2,500 games removed from Apple's China App Store after loophole shuts: data firm
Short Description: More than 2,500 mobile games were removed from Apple's China app store in the first week of July, four times as many in the same period in June, after Apple closed a loophole to comply with Chinese licence requirements, data from SensorTower showed.

Title: Crunch time for Apple in fight against $15 billion EU tax order
Short Description: Apple's clash with EU competition regulators comes to a head on Wednesday as Europe's second-highest court rules on whether it has to pay 13 billion euros ($15 billion) in Irish back taxes, a key part of the EU's crackdown against sweetheart tax deals.

Title: Apple says full return to offices not until the end of the year: Bloomberg News
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> has told its staff that a full return to U.S. offices will not occur before the end of the year, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing an internal video message.

Title: Apple to spend more than $400 million of $2.5 billion California housing fund this year
Short Description: Apple Inc on Monday said it has allocated more than $400 million of $2.5 billion it pledged last year to stem California's housing crisis.

Title: Exclusive: Apple supplier Foxconn to invest $1 billion in India, sources say
Short Description: Foxconn <2317.TW> plans to invest up to $1 billion to expand a factory in southern India where the Taiwanese contract manufacturer assembles Apple <AAPL.O> iPhones, two sources said.

Title: Nokia launches data centre networking tools, developed with Apple
Short Description: Finland's Nokia launched a set of tools on Thursday for data centre networking, developed in cooperation with Apple Inc, to help companies to manage the growth in traffic as 5G and machine learning technologies roll out.

Title: Apple expands independent repair shop program to Europe, Canada
Short Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it is expanding a program to supply repair parts, tools and manuals for iPhones to independent repair shops in 32 countries in Europe as well as Canada.

Title: Ruling in EU Apple tax case due next Wednesday: Ireland
Short Description: The European Union's second highest court will next week rule in an appeal by Apple <AAPL.O> and Ireland against an EU ruling for the U.S. company to pay 13 billion euros ($16 billion) in back taxes, the Irish government said on Wednesday.

Title: Ruling in EU Apple tax case due next Wednesday - Ireland
Short Description: The European Union's second highest court will next week rule in an appeal by Apple and Ireland against a European Union ruling for the U.S. firm to pay 13 billion euros ($16 billion), the Irish government said on Wednesday.

Title: Traders thought Apple had 'the holy grail' of oil data, but the quest continues
Short Description: Every day, energy merchants collect and scrutinize whatever information they can find on fuel demand to get a trading edge: from satellite data tracking oil tankers worldwide to thermal images from cameras on pipelines and storage tanks.

Title: UK regulators take aim at Apple's search engine deal with Google
Short Description: The payments by Alphabet Inc's Google to Apple Inc to be the default search engine on Apple's Safari web browser create "a significant barrier to entry and expansion" for Google's rivals in the search engine market, the UK markets regulator said in a report released on Wednesday...

Title: UK regulators take aim at Apple's search engine deal with Google
Short Description: The payments by Alphabet Inc's Google to Apple Inc to be the default search engine on Apple's Safari web browser create "a significant barrier to entry and expansion" for Google's rivals in the search engine market, the UK markets regulator said in a report released on Wednesday...
