Short Description: The payments by Alphabet Inc's Google to Apple Inc to be the default search engine on Apple's Safari web browser create "a significant barrier to entry and expansion" for Google's rivals in the search engine market, the UK markets regulator said in a report released on Wednesday...

Title: Apple to re-close more stores in seven U.S. states, bringing total to 77
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said it would re-close more than two dozen stores in seven states starting Thursday, including its home state of California, bringing total closures to 77 as coronavirus cases continue to rise.

Title: Apple not dominant in any market, plenty of rivals, senior executive says
Short Description: IPhone maker Apple, the target of EU antitrust investigations into key segments of its business, on Tuesday rejected accusations of market dominance, saying it competes with Google, Samsung and other rivals.

Title: New York Times ends partnership with Apple News
Short Description: The New York Times Co said on Monday it will end its partnership with Apple News, effective June 29, at a time when the publisher is shifting focus to a digital subscription-based model.

Title: Apple to close 14 stores in Florida as virus cases rise, total re-closures reaches 32
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said on Thursday that it would close 14 stores in Florida starting Friday due to a rise in COVID-19 cases, bringing its total re-closures to 32 stores in the United States.

Title: Apple to shut seven retail stores in Houston again as COVID-19 cases jump
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> is set to shut seven of its retail locations in Houston, Texas again due to an increase in the number of novel coronavirus cases in the United States, the company said Wednesday.

Title: Apple acquires startup aimed at managing corporate Macs, iPads
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> has acquired Fleetsmith, a San Francisco-based startup company whose technology helps businesses manage Apple's Mac and iPad devices among their employee bases.

Title: Apple switches to its own chips for Mac computers as it adds features, privacy controls
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> on Monday said it will switch to its own chips for its Mac computers, saying the first machines will ship this year and ending a nearly 15-year reliance on Intel Corp to supply processors for its flagship laptops and desktop.

Title: Apple to shut some U.S. stores again due to rising COVID-19 cases
Short Description: Apple Inc said on Friday it is temporarily shutting some stores again in Florida, Arizona, South Carolina, and North Carolina in the United States, as novel coronavirus cases continue to rise in the country.

Title: Apple says disappointed with EU antitrust investigations
Short Description: Apple <AAPL.O> on Tuesday accused a few companies of filing groundless complaints and criticised EU antitrust regulators for listening to them and opening two investigations into its Apple Pay and App Store.

Title: Apple's App Store, Apple Pay targeted by EU antitrust regulators
Short Description: Apple <AAPL.O> is being investigated by EU antitrust regulators over its App Store and mobile payment system Apple Pay as the bloc turns up the heat on gatekeepers of online platforms on which thousands of companies depend for business.

Title: Apple-backed study sheds light on physical sales through App Store
Short Description: Apple Inc on Monday released the results of a study that found its App Store spurred $458 billion in sales last year from categories such as retail of physical goods, ride-hailing and advertising from which the iPhone maker takes no commission.

Title: Apple, YouTube unveil $100 million funds to support black causes amid U.S. protests
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said on Thursday it will increase spending with black-owned suppliers as part of a $100 million racial equity and justice initiative, while Google-owned <GOOGL.O> YouTube said it will spend $100 million to fund black artists.

Title: Apple must face U.S. shareholder lawsuit over CEO's iPhone, China comments
Short Description: A federal judge said Apple Inc must face part of a lawsuit claiming it fraudulently concealed falling demand for iPhones, especially in China, leading to tens of billions of dollars in shareholder losses.

Title: Apple to reopen about 100 U.S. stores, most with curbside pickup
Short Description: Apple Inc plans to reopen about 100 U.S. stores, mostly with curbside pickup but some with walk-in service, the company said on Tuesday.

Title: Irish regulator questions Apple over recordings
Short Description: Ireland's Data Protection Commissioner (DPC), Apple's main regulator in the European Union, on Thursday said it was in contact with the company after a whistleblower called for action over a programme that listens to users' recordings.

Title: Apple reopening 25 more U.S. stores, will soon top 100 worldwide
Short Description: Apple Inc will this week reopen more than 25 of its branded stores in the United States, the company said on Sunday, continuing a gradual process that has unlocked doors at nearly a fifth of its worldwide retail outlets.

Title: Apple awards $10 million to nasal swab maker COPAN Diagnostics to help boost factory output
Short Description: Apple Inc said on Thursday that it was awarding $10 million to a maker of nasal swabs and other materials for collecting samples for Covid-19 tests in a move aimed at boosting the swab maker's production to 1 million collection kits per week by early July.

Title: Apple borrows on the cheap to fund buybacks, dividends
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> on Monday capitalized on the Federal Reserve's emergency measures in response to the coronavirus outbreak to issue its cheapest bonds in years, making it the latest blue-chip company to do so to fund stock buybacks and dividends.

Title: Apple sales inch higher despite coronavirus but CEO Tim Cook sees uncertain future
Short Description: Apple Inc reported sales and profits that beat Wall Street expectations Thursday, with Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook saying China sales were "headed in the right direction" as that country reopens from the novel coronavirus.

Title: China discounts, cheaper iPhone to cushion Apple from virus blow to demand
Short Description: Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> discounts on the iPhone 11 in China and the release of a new low-price SE model have put the company in a better position than rivals to weather a coronavirus-related plunge in global smartphone demand.

Title: Apple, Google update coronavirus contact tracing tech ahead of launch
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> and Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google on Friday updated technical details of the coronavirus contact tracing system they plan to release next month, saying new features would strengthen privacy protections and give health authorities more detailed data.

Title: Apple says 'no evidence' iPhone mail flaw used against customers
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said on Thursday it has found "no evidence" a flaw in its email app for iPhones and iPads has been used against customers, and that it believes the flaw does "not pose an immediate risk to our users".

Title: Apple says 'no evidence' iPhone mail flaw used against customers
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said on Thursday it has found "no evidence" a flaw in its email app for iPhones and iPads has been used against customers, and that it believes the flaw does "not pose an immediate risk to our users".

Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said on Thursday it has found "no evidence" a flaw in its email app for iPhones and iPads has been used against customers, and that it believes the flaw does "not pose an immediate risk to our users".

Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said on Thursday it has found "no evidence" a flaw in its email app for iPhones and iPads has been used against customers, and that it believes the flaw does "not pose an immediate risk to our users".

Title: Apple plans to sell Macs with its own chips from 2021: Bloomberg
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> plans to sell Mac computers with its own main processors by next year based on the chip designs currently used in its iPhones and iPads, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.

Title: Flaw in iPhone, iPads may have allowed hackers to steal data for years
Short Description: Apple Inc is planning to fix a flaw that a security firm said may have left more than half a billion iPhones vulnerable to hackers.

Title: Goldman predicts 36% drop in iPhone shipment, says time to sell Apple shares
Short Description: Goldman Sachs said on Friday it expects iPhone shipment to drop 36% during the current quarter due to coronavirus-related lockdowns around the world and downgraded Apple Inc stock to "sell".

Title: Apple to reopen its sole branded store in South Korea on April 18
Short Description: Apple Inc said on Thursday it would reopen its sole retail store in South Korea on April 18, marking it the first site to return to business after it closed all stores outside Greater China last month due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Title: Apple's budget iPhone unlikely to make splash in China: Weibo poll
Short Description: Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> new iPhone SE for the budget-conscious is unlikely to be a major driver of sales in China, a Weibo survey suggested, with analysts noting its lacks of 5G capability.

Title: U.S. senator says Apple, Google need to show contact tracing will not violate privacy
Short Description: Smartphone software makers Alphabet's Google and Apple will have to convince the public that any contact tracing technology to track who has been exposed to the new coronavirus will not lead to a violation of their privacy, Senator Richard Blumenthal said on Wednesday.

Title: Apple has a $399 iPhone SE for the budget-conscious as coronavirus stalls economy
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> on Wednesday released a smaller iPhone priced at $399, cutting the starting price for the company's smartphone line in a move to broaden its appeal to budget-conscious customers as the coronavirus hobbles the global economy.

Title: Apple launches site to show how coronavirus lockdowns affect movement
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said on Tuesday it would release data that could help inform public health authorities on whether people are driving less during lockdown orders to slow the spread of the new coronavirus.

Title: Apple, Google to create contact tracing technology to fight coronavirus spread
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> and Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google said on Friday that they will work together to create contact tracing technology that aims to slow the spread of the coronavirus by allowing users to opt into a system that catalogs other phones they have been near.

Title: Apple, Google plan software to slow virus, joining global debate on tracking
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> and Alphabet Inc's <GOOGL.O> Google said on Friday that they will work together to create contact tracing technology that aims to slow the spread of the coronavirus by allowing users to opt into logging other phones they have been near.

Title: Apple will stop taking cut of some Amazon video purchases on App Store
Short Description: Apple Inc said on Wednesday it would stop taking a cut of some sales for "qualifying" streaming video services on iPhones and other Apple devices, including Amazon.com's Prime Video.

Title: Apple doubles China donations for COVID-19 recovery efforts
Short Description: Apple more than doubled its donation to China's efforts to fight COVID-19 to over 50 million yuan ($7 million), CEO Tim Cook posted on Weibo on Wednesday, weeks after the iPhone maker said it had opened all its 42 stores in one of its largest markets.

Title: Apple supplier Japan Display finalises deal to raise $200 million from 'customer'
Short Description: Japan Display said on Tuesday it has finalised a deal to raise $200 million from "an overseas customer," which sources have said is Apple.

Title: Apple's factories are running, but suppliers wary about iPhone demand
Short Description: As China reopens its economy after months of lockdown, Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> iPhone factories are largely up and running. But with the coronavirus pandemic spreading across the world, the urgent question for the company is how many buyers there will be both for current models...

Title: Apple works with White House to release 'COVID-19' app, website
Short Description: Apple Inc and the White House said on Friday that the iPhone maker worked with the Trump administration and federal agencies to release an app and website that will direct users to guidance from the Centers for Disease Control on the disease caused by the coronavirus.

Title: Apple expects to start reopening some stores in first half of April: Bloomberg News
Short Description: Apple Inc could start re-opening some of its retail stores in the first half of April, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing an internal memo.

Title: U.S. trade regulators approve tariff exemption for Apple Watches
Short Description: U.S. trade regulators have approved Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> request to waive tariffs on China-made Apple Watches, the Office of the United States Trade Representative said in a letter dated Friday.

Title: Apple scraps curbs on online buyers of iPhones amid virus outbreak
Short Description: Apple has dropped a two-device limit on online purchases of iPhones, a check of its web stores showed on Monday, just days after changing the checkout procedure amid a coronavirus pandemic.

Title: Apple limits online iPhone purchases to two per person amid coronavirus
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> is limiting customer purchases of iPhones over its online stores in many countries including the United States and China to a maximum of two handsets per person, checks on its website on Friday revealed.

Title: Apple brings back 'scissor' keyboards in latest MacBook Air
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> launched an updated version of its MacBook Air on Wednesday, modifying keyboards on its laptop line that have faced criticism for typing-related problems.

Title: French antitrust regulator fines Apple $1.2 billion
Short Description: France's competition watchdog on Monday fined iPhone maker Apple 1.1 billion euros ($ 1.23 billion), saying it was guilty of anti-competitive behavior towards its distribution and retail network.

Title: Apple, some U.S. retailers close stores to contain virus
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> said it is closing all its retail stores, except those in Greater China, for the next two weeks to minimize the risk of coronavirus transmission, a move that was followed by several U.S. retailers on Saturday.

Title: Apple shifts annual developers conference to online-only format
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> on Friday moved its annual developers conference in San Jose, California, in June entirely online, citing the "current health situation."

Title: Apple says reopening all its branded stores in China
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> is reopening all 42 of its branded stores in China on Friday, a company spokesman said, more than a month after they were shut in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.

Title: French watchdog to fine Apple over anti-competitive behaviour, sources say
Short Description: France's competition watchdog is set to fine iPhone maker Apple Inc <AAPL.O> next Monday over anti-competitive behaviour in its distribution and sales network, two sources close to the matter said on Thursday.

Title: French watchdog set to fine Apple over anti-competitive behaviour - sources
Short Description: France's competition watchdog is set to fine iPhone maker Apple next Monday over anti-competitive behaviour in its distribution and sales network, two sources close to the matter said on Thursday.

Title: Coronavirus case at Apple's Irish HQ, Trinity College goes online
Short Description: A worker at Apple's European headquarters in Cork in Ireland has tested positive for coronavirus, one of 24 cases reported so far in the country where its oldest university, Trinity College, has been forced to move all lectures online.

Title: Apple sells fewer than 500,000 smartphones in China in February amid coronavirus
Short Description: Apple <AAPL.O> sold fewer than half a million iPhones in China in February, government data showed on Monday, as the coronavirus outbreak halved demand for smartphones.

Title: Apple, Netflix pull out of South by Southwest festival amid coronavirus outbreak
Short Description: Apple Inc and Netflix Inc said they were pulling out of the South by Southwest music and tech festival to be held later this month, amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Title: Apple stock rebounds almost 7% to head for strongest day since 2018
Short Description: Shares in Apple <AAPL.O> surged 6.9% on Monday, helped by a broad Wall Street rebound and an upgraded rating from an analyst who said the iPhone maker's stock had become oversold following last week's rout related to fears about the new coronavirus.

Title: Apple to pay up to $500 million to settle U.S. lawsuit over slow iPhones
Short Description: Apple Inc has agreed to pay up to $500 million to settle litigation accusing it of quietly slowing down older iPhones as it launched new models, to induce owners to buy replacement phones or batteries.

Title: Apple closely watching coronavirus outbreak in South Korea, Italy: CEO
Short Description: Apple Inc is closely watching how the coronavirus outbreak is unfolding in South Korea and Italy, where the company has suppliers, Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook said in an interview.

Title: Apple investor vote sounds 'warning' over China app takedowns
Short Description: An Apple Inc shareholder proposal critical of the company's app removals in China received a relatively high level of support at the iPhone maker's annual meeting on Wednesday, enough to push the company to respond, experts said.

Title: Coronavirus clouds Apple's timeline for new iPhones

Title: Apple CEO Tim Cook calls for more global trade with China

Short Description: Apple will set up two new research and development centers in Shanghai and Suzhou in China, it said in a statement in its Chinese website on Friday.

Title: RPT-Apple's Siri learns Shanghainese as voice assistants race to cover languages
Short Description: With the broad release of Google Assistant last week, the voice-assistant wars are in full swing, with Apple Inc, Amazon.com Inc, Microsoft Corp and now Alphabet Inc's Google all offering electronic assistants to take your commands.

Short Description: * Apple says users are experiencing a problem with services such as the App Store, Apple Music and Apple TV among others - website Source text : http://apple.co/2m4dIVi Further company coverage:

Short Description: Apple Inc and German software maker SAP SE will release a tool aimed at helping developers build iPhone apps for big businesses, the two companies said on Monday.

Title: Buffett's Berkshire more than doubled its stake in Apple: CNBC
Short Description: (Repeats February 27 story with no change to text following corrections for previous stories in this series.)

Short Description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc <BRKa.N> is sitting on more than $1.6 billion of gains in its investment in Apple Inc. <AAPL.O> after shares of the iPhone maker surged.

Title: BRIEF-Apple Inc director Albert Gore Jr sells 215,437 shares of co's common stock on Feb 22
Short Description: * Apple Inc director Albert Gore Jr reports sale of 215,437 shares of co's common stock on Feb 22 at $136.72 per share - SEC filing Source text: (http://bit.ly/2lT6h3z) Further company coverage:

Title: Tech breakthroughs take a backseat in upcoming Apple iPhone launch
Short Description: When Apple Inc <AAPL.O> launches its much-anticipated 10th anniversary iPhone this fall, it will offer an unwitting lesson in how much the smartphone industry it pioneered has matured.

Title: Apple breaks intraday record high for first time since 2015
Short Description: Apple Inc's share price hit an intraday record high on Tuesday for the first time in almost two years as investors raised bets that a 10th anniversary iPhone will boost lackluster sales.

Title: Apple hits record high but leaves some investors in dust

Title: Australian banks narrow focus of Apple Pay collective bargaining request
Short Description: Australian banks seeking permission from the country's competition regulator to bargain collectively with Apple Inc <AAPL.O> over its mobile payment system said on Monday they will focus on gaining access to the U.S. tech company's contactless payment function, removing...

Title: Apple sows seeds for India iPhone awakening
Short Description: Apple is planting the seeds for India's iPhone awakening. The $695 billion company is nearing a deal to assemble its iconic phone in Karnataka, a southwestern state in one of the world's fastest growing handset markets. That would help lower retail prices and boost potential...

Title: Macquarie, ING join Apple Pay in Australia in challenge to Big Four

Title: Channeling Steve Jobs, Apple seeks design perfection at new 'spaceship' campus

Short Description: John Solomon, hired by Apple to sell its products to big businesses and government, has left his position, the company said on Tuesday.

Title: Wistron plant in Indian tech hub solely for iPhone: source

Title: Irish calculation similar to EU on Apple tax estimate: minister
Short Description: The European Commission's estimate that Apple <AAPL.O> owes Ireland up to 13 billion euros ($14 billion) in a disputed tax ruling is unlikely to be altered greatly by Dublin's calculations, the Irish finance minister said on Thursday.

Title: Strong iPhone 7 sales 'a bridge' to Apple's next upgrade
Short Description: "Things don't have to change the world to be important," Apple Inc <AAPL.O> co-founder Steve Jobs said in an interview in 1996.

Title: Apple working harder to squeeze iPhone juice
Short Description: Apple is working harder to squeeze juice out of its iconic iPhone. The company sold more units in the holiday quarter, yet profit fell. A saturating market and slowing innovation aren't helping margins. Yet the prospect of a new phone and the ability to sell additional services...

Title: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Apple reports blockbuster quarter as iPhone sales top estimates
Short Description: Apple Inc reported its first quarterly increase in iPhone sales in a year, powered by strong demand for the latest version of its flagship smartphone, sending the company's shares up more than 3 percent in after-hours trading.

Title: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Apple reports blockbuster quarter as iPhone sales top estimates
Short Description: Apple Inc reported a bigger-than-expected rise in iPhone sales for the holiday quarter, driven by strong demand for the latest version of its flagship smartphone.

Title: Apple defies Wall Street with strong revival in iPhone sales
Short Description: Apple Inc reclaimed the throne as the world's top smartphone seller for the first time in five years on Tuesday, beating out rival Samsung in units shipped for the holiday quarter and boosting revenues with a strong showing for its new, top-of-the-line iPhone 7 Plus.

Title: Apple iPhone sales beat estimates
Short Description: Apple Inc reported a bigger-than-expected rise in iPhone sales for the holiday quarter but forecast current-quarter revenue below estimates as customers hold back on phone upgrades in anticipation of the launch of the 10th-anniversary iPhone.

Title: Apple strategy in 'smart home' race threatened by Amazon
Short Description: SAN FRANCISCO - In less than a year, Amazon's combination of the Echo speaker system and the Alexa voice-controlled digital assistant has come close to delivering on the elusive promise of easy-to-use technology that can control gadgets in the home with a few spoken words.

Title: Apple shares back in vogue as Wall Street bets on iPhone surge
Short Description: Wall Street has regained an appetite for Apple as investors bet that the release of a 10th-anniversary iPhone and pent up customer demand will shore up shrinking sales.

Title: As regulators waver, Apple takes on Qualcomm in courts
Short Description: Apple Inc's new legal assault on Qualcomm in the United States and China reflects its conclusion that regulators are unlikely to put an end to what it considers the chip maker's unfair business practices, analysts said.

Title: Apple sues Qualcomm in Beijing seeking 1 billion yuan
Short Description: Apple Inc filed a lawsuit against Qualcomm Inc in Beijing, alleging the chip supplier abused its clout in the chip industry and seeking 1 billion yuan ($145.32 million) in damages, Beijing's Intellectual Property Court said in a statement on Wednesday.

Title: Apple says dialogue with India on local expansion plans was 'constructive'

Title: U.S. trade commission to probe Nokia complaint against Apple

Title: Apple files $1 billion lawsuit against chip supplier Qualcomm

Title: EU antitrust regulators welcome Amazon, Apple audiobook deal

Title: Indian government wants Apple, but not all officials are biting

Title: India to consider Apple request for investment incentives with 'open mind'
Short Description: India will consider Apple's request for incentives to invest in the country with an "open mind", Information Technology Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad told reporters on Wednesday.

Title: After pound's fall, Apple to hike British app store prices

Title: U.S. appeals court revives antitrust lawsuit against Apple

Title: China state tabloid scolds New York Times for investigative reports

Title: REFILE-UPDATE 1-India reluctant to give special tax incentives to Apple
Short Description: India is resisting Apple Inc.'s demand for tax incentives to make iPhones in the country, with the trade minister saying on Thursday that New Delhi may not make exceptions for the U.S. tech giant.

Title: Factbox: Apps removed from Apple's China app store
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> removed the New York Times Co's <NYT.N> news apps from its app store in China on Dec. 23, following a request from the Chinese authorities. An Apple spokesman said the company had been informed that the app was "in violation of local regulations".

Title: Apple confirms $1 billion investment in SoftBank tech fund

Title: Apple partner Wistron seeks to expand India smartphone parts plant: government official

Title: Apple's new AirPods tough to recycle: report

Title: Ireland accuses EU of exceeding power in Apple tax case

Title: Apple appeals against EU tax ruling, Brussels says no cause for low tax bill

Title: NBCUniversal in deal to sell ads for Apple News

Title: Apple adds touch screen keys to MacBook Pro, price jump startles some

Title: Italy judge agrees tax probe settlement with head of Apple's Irish unit: source

Title: Apple says AirPod shipments to be delayed
Short Description: (The Oct 26 story was refiled to remove an incorrect reference to AirPods plugging into the same port as the recharging cord)

Title: Data Dive: Apple's big bet on India
Short Description: Despite a mixed bag in the earnings department and some troubling supply chain issues, Apple CEO Tim Cook remained upbeat about the companys growth potential  especially in India, where sales rose 50 percent from a year earlier.

Short Description: Apple Inc said it was caught off guard by how many people want to buy its biggest smartphone, the iPhone 7 Plus, and the miscalculation may hit profits this holiday season.

Title: Apple's holiday surprise: big sales, not so big profits

Title: Apple to set up R&D center in Shenzhen, bolster China ties
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> will set up a research and development center in China's manufacturing metropolis Shenzhen, the U.S. tech giant said on Wednesday, as the firm looks to spur growth in the world's second largest economy amid growing competition.

Short Description: Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> stock on Monday jumped 2.3 percent, reaching a high not seen since December, after rival Samsung Electronics Co Ltd <005930.KS> suspended production of its flagship Galaxy Note 7 smartphones following reports of fires in replacement devices.

Title: U.S. court reinstates Apple $120 mln patent win over Samsung
Short Description: A federal appeals court on Friday reinstated a $120 million jury award for Apple Inc against Samsung, marking the latest twist in the fierce patent war between the world's top smartphone manufacturers.

Title: U.S. court reinstates Apple $120 million patent win over Samsung
Short Description: A federal appeals court on Friday reinstated a $120 million jury award for Apple Inc <AAPL.O> against Samsung <005930.KS>, marking the latest twist in the fierce patent war between the world's top smartphone manufacturers.

Short Description: Shares of Apple Inc <AAPL.O> rose 1 percent on Thursday after German supplier Dialog Semiconductor Plc <DLGS.DE> said its quarterly revenue were higher than expected, adding to recent enthusiasm about demand for the newest iPhone.

Title: Apple launches Apple Pay payment service in Russia
Short Description: Apple Inc launched its Apple Pay software in Russia on Tuesday as the U.S. technology firm extends the global reach of its payment service.

Title: Apple loses patent retrial to VirnetX, owes $302.4 million

Title: Apple deepens enterprise push with Deloitte partnership
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> and Deloitte LLP announced a partnership on Wednesday in which the consultant will open a new practice to help corporate clients work with Apple products, the tech firm's latest attempt to boost enterprise sales as its key product, the iPhone, shows signs...

Short Description: Technology giant Apple <AAPL.O> said on Wednesday it is moving its London headquarters to the landmark Battersea Power Station, a move hailed by the government as a sign that major firms are still investing after the Brexit vote.

Short Description: U.S. health insurer Aetna Inc said it would offer some customers discounts on Apple Inc's smartwatch, marking the first deal made by the tech giant with an insurer for its devices.

Title: Exclusive: Japan's antitrust watchdog considers action against Apple, carriers - sources
Short Description: Japanese regulators are considering taking action against Apple Inc over possible antitrust violations that may have helped it dominate the nation's smartphone sales, government sources said, a move that could hit the company's profit margins in one of its most profitable...

Title: Supercar maker McLaren says not in discussion with Apple
Short Description: McLaren damped down a report on Wednesday that Apple Inc had made an approach for the British Formula One team owner and supercar maker.

Title: Apple's iPhone 7 more expensive to make: IHS Markit

Title: Apple fans hit the NYC flagship store for iPhone 7

Title: Apple Japan unit ordered to pay $118 million tax for underreporting income: media

Title: Fans cheer, but iPhone 7 gets a subdued welcome

Title: Apple stock heads for best four days since 2014; short sellers flee

Title: Apple says initial quantities of iPhone 7 Plus sold out

Title: Japan government advisory panel says Apple, Google hinder app competition

Title: Political? Mais oui, of course, EU insiders say of Apple case

Title: EU ruling on Apple stirs calls for U.S. tax reform

Title: EU hits Apple with $14.5 billion Irish tax demand

Title: Apple to boost China investments as demand slows

Title: Apple offers big cash rewards for help finding security bugs

Title: Designers come out for Apple in patent fight with Samsung

Short Description: Apple Inc patents covering the "slide to unlock" feature on smartphones are invalid, Germany's highest appeals court ruled on Tuesday, reaffirming a 2013 decision rejecting the U.S. company's claims by a lower court.

Title: Apple, BMW in courtship with an eye on car collaboration
Short Description: BMW <BMWG.DE> and Apple <AAPL.O> may rekindle a courtship put on hold after an exploratory visit by executives of the world's top maker of electronic gadgets to the headquarters of the word's biggest seller of premium cars.

Title: Apple Pay launches in Britain as holdout Barclays signs up
Short Description: Apple introduced its mobile payments service to Britain on Tuesday as Barclays became the last major UK bank to sign up for the U.S. tech giant's effort to capitalize on the increasing comfort among British consumers with making tap-and-go purchases.

Title: Apple persuades U.S. judge to void $533 million iTunes award
Short Description: A federal judge has thrown out a $532.9 million award against Apple Inc and ordered a new trial on damages, in a case where a jury found that the iPhone maker's iTunes software infringed three patents owned by a Texas company.

Title: Apple gets partial win on appeal in Samsung patent case
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> was handed a mixed ruling by a U.S. appeals court in the latest twist in a blockbuster intellectual property battle with Samsung Electronics Co Ltd <005930.KS>, as a prior patent infringement verdict was upheld but a trademark finding that the iPhone's...

Title: Ericsson extends patent suits against Apple to Europe
Short Description: Swedish telecom equipment maker Ericsson has filed lawsuits in Germany, Britain and the Netherlands against Apple over technology license payments, Ericsson said on Friday, extending a U.S. battle between the firms to Europe.

Title: Chinese demand for Apple's big-screen phones fuel sales growth
Short Description: Apple's large-screen iPhones are a big hit in China, taking market share from Samsung and selling at a pace that may make China a greater source of revenue than the Americas for Apple in coming years, analysts said.

Title: Samsung hints at new smartwatch on Apple Watch launch day
Short Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd teased the market with hints of a new version of its Gear smartwatch on Friday, the same day that rival Apple Inc's long-awaited wearable devices went on sale.

Title: Apple thwarts geeks, investors probing smartwatch components
Short Description: Apple Inc managed to frustrate gadget lovers and investors desperate to find out the components of its new smartwatch on Friday, encasing its chips in tough resin and using rare screws to thwart people trying prise it apart.

Title: Brazil's iPhone investment falls short on promises of jobs, lower prices
Short Description: The Brazilian iPhone was meant to mark a new era.

Title: With primetime TV, Apple hopes to hook customers for new Watch
Short Description: As Apple Inc <AAPL.O> debuts its smartwatch on Friday, the technology company focused efforts to drum up buzz on U.S. television, using expensive primetime spots to entice customers to the fledgling wearable technology market.

Title: Apple faces local battles as it prepares global payments push
Short Description: Apple <AAPL.O> has made mobile payments look easy, after a decade of mostly failed experiments by banks, telecom operators and retailers to woo consumers away from cards and cash.

Title: Swiss launch of Apple Watch hit by patent issue: TV
Short Description: Apple is not able to launch its new smartwatch in Switzerland until at least the end of this year because of an intellectual property rights issue, Swiss broadcaster RTS reported on its website.

Title: New apps to help business get in step with mobile customers
Short Description: Nine months after Apple and IBM began working together on building mobile apps for businesses, some of the first fruits are about to appear at UK pharmacy chain Boots, which has begun equipping store employees with iPads to serve shoppers in the aisles.

Title: U.S. jury clears Apple of infringing wireless tech patents
Short Description: A federal jury in Texas on Monday said Apple Inc did not infringe five wireless technology patents owned by Canadian patent licensing firm Conversant Intellectual Property Management Inc [GEGGIM.UL] .

Title: Apple Watch not yet setting Chinese pulses racing
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> had China front and center at the San Francisco launch of its smart Apple Watch, trumpeting a new store in Hangzhou city and demo-ing hit Chinese messaging app WeChat.

Title: Judges wary of Apple's claims of phone patent harm by Samsung
Short Description: Apple Inc told a U.S. appeals court on Wednesday that rival Samsung Electronics Co Ltd should be barred from selling products that infringe on its smartphone patents, but the judges were skeptical.

Title: What would the Dow look like if it included Apple?
Short Description: It may be by far the most valuable American company but Apple Inc still cant get into at least one exclusive club  the 30-member Dow Jones Industrial Average.

Title: Apple car rumors fuel Geneva debate about car of future
Short Description: The main talking point at this week's Geneva car show is likely to be a vehicle that may never be built: the Apple car.

Title: Apple faces second suit from victorious patent firm
Short Description: Fresh off a $532.9 million jury win against Apple Inc <AAPL.O>, a Texas company is again suing the tech giant, this time over the same patents' use in devices introduced after the original case was underway.

Title: Apple ordered to pay $533 million for patent infringement
Short Description: Apple Inc has been ordered to pay $532.9 million after a federal jury in Texas found that its iTunes software infringed three patents owned by patent licensing firm Smartflash LLC.

Title: Apple hiring big brains in car battery space
Short Description: A year and a half ago, Apple Inc <AAPL.O> had applied for just eight patents related to auto batteries. Recently, it has hired a bevy of engineers, just one of whom had already filed for 17 in his former career, according to a Thomson Reuters analysis.

Title: Apple is working on creating a car: WSJ
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> has a secret lab working on the creation of an Apple-branded electric car, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Apple hiring auto experts for secret research project: FT
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> is hiring automotive technology and design experts to staff up a top-secret research lab, with the possible intention of building a car, the Financial Times reported on Friday, citing several people familiar with the iPhone maker.

Title: U.S. approves first biotech apple that resists browning
Short Description: U.S. regulators on Friday approved what would be the first commercialized biotech apple, rejecting efforts by the organic industry and other GMO critics to block the new fruit.

Title: Apple $1 trillion stock market value could be years away
Short Description: Activist Investor Carl Icahn thinks Apple Inc is already worth over $1 trillion but others on Wall St. think it will take a few more years for the iPhone maker's stock value to get there.

Title: Ericsson files complaint against Apple over tech license payments
Short Description: Swedish telecom equipment supplier Ericsson said on Wednesday it filed a complaint against Apple Inc over mobile technology license payments, responding to a lawsuit from the iPhone maker earlier this month.

Title: Apple sues Ericsson over LTE wireless telecom patents
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> sued Ericsson <ERICb.ST> alleging that the Swedish company's LTE wireless technology patents are not essential to industry cellular standards and that it is demanding excessive royalties for these patents.

Title: Apple granted patent for GoPro-like wearable cameras
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> has been granted a patent for a wearable camera that could possibly challenge action cameras made by GoPro Inc <GPRO.O>.

Title: Advertisers to get a glimpse of Apple Watch promise, challenge
Short Description: Apples forthcoming smartwatch poses a conundrum for advertisers: How to tap the enticing possibilities of the tiny gadget without overwhelming consumers with messages.

Title: Special Report - Crunch time: As sanctions bite, Putin ally gets into apples
Short Description: As U.S. and European sanctions piled pressure on Russia earlier this year, the Kremlin hit back with an unusual weapon: apples.

Title: Apple antitrust case over iPods nears jury deliberations
Short Description: A software update for Apple Inc's iPod music player was not a product improvement, but was intended to improperly raise costs for consumers who wanted to switch to newer devices, an attorney for Apple customers said in court.

Title: U.S. faces tough questions in Apple e-books antitrust appeal
Short Description: A U.S. government lawyer faced tough questioning in an appeals court on Monday as he sought to defend a judge's ruling that Apple Inc conspired with five publishers to raise e-book prices.

Title: Samsung asks appeals court to throw out $930 million damages in Apple infringement case
Short Description: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd <005930.KS> asked a U.S. appeals court on Thursday to toss out an order that it pay Apple Inc <AAPL.O> $930 million for infringing on iPhone patents to make its Galaxy line of smartphones and tablets.

Title: Exclusive: Apple's enterprise assault gets into higher gear
Short Description: Apple Inc <AAPL.O> is embarking on its most aggressive expansion yet onto corporate turf, hiring a dedicated sales force to talk with potential clients like Citigroup Inc <C.N> and working in concert with a dozen or so developers, two sources familiar with its plans say.

Title: Early Apple computer sells for $905,000 at auction
Short Description: One of the few remaining examples of Apple Inc's first pre-assembled computer, Apple-1, sold for $905,000 at an auction in New York on Wednesday, far outstripping expectations.

Title: Apple's new iPads sport modest upgrades but short on 'wow'
Short Description: Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> faster, slimmer iPads come with modest improvements, such as a fingerprint sensor, but some analysts say it offers few other features to wow consumers ahead of a holiday shopping season expected to be swamped by mobile devices.

Title: 'Hairgate': iPhone hit by new social media storm
Short Description: First there was bendgate... now brace yourself for hairgate.

Title: GN Resound pins hopes on hearing aid for iPhone generation
Short Description: Denmark's GN Resound is banking on a hearing aid packed with bluetooth-like technology that lets users listen to calls and music from their iPhones as it seeks to steal a march on its rivals, its new chief executive told Reuters.

Title: Apple on medical tech hiring spree, a possible hint of iWatch plans
Short Description: Apple Inc is building a team of senior medical technology executives, raising hackles in the biotechnology community and offering a hint of what the iPhone maker may be planning for its widely expected iWatch and other wearable technology.

Title: Apple's sales boom in communist Vietnam
Short Description: (This story corrects period for sales in the first paragraph)

Title: Mayer aims to persuade Apple to choose Yahoo over Google: Re/code
Short Description: Yahoo Inc's Chief Executive Marissa Mayer is working on a plan to persuade Apple Inc to ditch Google as its default search engine in favor of Yahoo, technology news site Re/code reported, citing sources within Yahoo.

Title: Apple to probe death of Chinese woman who used iPhone when it was charging
Short Description: Apple Inc is investigating an accident in which a Chinese woman was killed by an electric shock when answering a call on her iPhone 5 while it was charging, the U.S. technology company said on Monday.

Title: Apple options soar as market awaits dividend
Short Description: * Shareholders at Wednesday's close eligible for $2.65 dividend

Title: Key excerpts from Steve Jobs' biography
Short Description: A new biography of late Apple Inc co-founder Steve Jobs hit book-shelves on Monday, offering arguably the most comprehensive, insightful look to date at the life and times of the revered technology visionary.

Title: Key excerpts from Steve Jobs' biography
Short Description: A new biography of late Apple Inc co-founder Steve Jobs hit book-shelves on Monday, offering arguably the most comprehensive, insightful look to date at the life and times of the revered technology visionary.

Title: Key excerpts from Steve Jobs' biography
Short Description: A new biography of late Apple Inc co-founder Steve Jobs hit book-shelves on Monday, offering arguably the most comprehensive, insightful look to date at the life and times of the revered technology visionary.
